title: How to Make Glamorgan Sausages

steps.headline: Put the cheese, fresh breadcrumbs, mustard, onion, and herbs in the food processor.
steps.description: Process until the ingredients are combined but not too much.

steps.headline: Crack the eggs and separate one yolk from one of the eggs.
steps.description: Reserve the egg white. Add one whole egg and the extra egg yolk to the processor. Process quickly.

steps.headline: Remove the mixture from the processor.
steps.description: Wash your hands and prepare to roll the sausages.

steps.headline: Roll out approximately 8 sausage shapes.
steps.description: This is best done on a non-stick surface such as baking paper or greaseproof paper laid over a wooden board. Adjust until you are happy with the shapes.

steps.headline: Whisk the egg white till it froths.
steps.description: Roll each sausage in the whisked egg white. Follow by rolling in the flour to coat.

steps.headline: Heat the oil in the frying pan over low heat.
steps.description: Cook the sausages in the oil until browned. Attend to them at all times, turning regularly.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: These are best served immediately with a suitable sauce or a gravy. Fried onion pieces are also an ideal addition and mashed potatoes.

text: Put the cheese, fresh breadcrumbs, mustard, onion, and herbs in the food processor. Process until the ingredients are combined but not too much. Add seasoning to taste.  Crack the eggs and separate one yolk from one of the eggs. Reserve the egg white. Add one whole egg and the extra egg yolk to the processor. Process quickly. Remove the mixture from the processor. Wash your hands and prepare to roll the sausages. Roll out approximately 8 sausage shapes. This is best done on a non-stick surface such as baking paper or greaseproof paper laid over a wooden board. Adjust until you are happy with the shapes. Whisk the egg white till it froths. Roll each sausage in the whisked egg white. Follow by rolling in the flour to coat. Heat the oil in the frying pan over low heat. Cook the sausages in the oil until browned. Attend to them at all times, turning regularly. Serve. These are best served immediately with a suitable sauce or a gravy. Fried onion pieces are also an ideal addition and mashed potatoes.
